dialogues.speaker: EXT. AN ALLEY WAY
dialogues.text: A DARK FIGURE in a tattered trench coat tumbles onto the pavement, hands out to slow the impact. A beat then slowl he climbs to his feet, recovering from what seems to have been quite a fall. He has chiseled features, shaved head, deep-set eyes. Looks like he's been through one hell of a fight. His name, we will come to know, is MICHAEL. He quickly checks out his surroundings, nothing but brick walls above him. Where'd this guy jump from? A RUMBLE of thunder...then RAIN starts to hammer down. to motivate him. Michael pulls his overcoat tight around his body and dash toward the mouth of the alley. He reaches the STREET just time to see a FLEET OF POLICE CARS tearing around the cor SIRENS WAILING, heading this way. He reels back into the alley way, ducks down behind a tra dumpster, as the BLUE AND RED LIGHTS of the POLICE CARS w past. Michael waits for the lights to disappear, then he pulls MASSIVE ORNATE KNIFE from his jacket. Considers it grimly Runs his finger along its edge. Blood beads up. Razor sharp. Michael begins to peel off his overcoat, revealing his ba chest underneath...and skin literally covered with DARK TATOOS. Hard to see what they are in this light. As his coat falls to the ground, we DRIFT over to the BRI WALL behind him where we see MICHAEL'S SHADOW crouch over and then...

dialogues.speaker: WHAT ARE UNMISTAKABLY...THE SHADOW OF WINGS.
dialogues.text: The RAIN POUNDS harder, as if punishment from the heavens The glint of the KNIFE coming down fast. A HORRENDOUS SOUND OF FLESH TEARING AWAY FROM BONE... ...THE BLOODY KNIFE CLATTERING TO THE PAVEMENT...

dialogues.speaker: ...FOLLOWED BY MICHAEL'S UNGODLY SCREAM RISING UP FROM TH
dialogues.text: ALLEY WAY. And then SILENCE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, face tight with pain, trench coat back on, steps of the alley, stares with determination at a dark storefr across the street. "GUN & SPORT WORLD"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GUN & SPORT WORLD - A SHORT WHILE LATER Cavernous. A Costco for survivalists.    Quiet except for sound of RAIN, then... SMASH! Michael drops down through one of the skylights in shower of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GUN & SPORT WORLD - BATHROOM - MOMENTS LATER Michael bursts in. Tosses a first-aid kit into the sink. His trench coat falls to the floor and here in the fluorescent light, we get a better look at him. His thin but stunningly well muscled body is TATTOOED shoulder to ankle with INTRICATE WRITING. The man's flesh a living book. But the writing is in no language we recognize. He turns his back to the mirror, revealing two HORRIFICAL OPEN WOUNDS running down between both shoulder blades. FRESH. BLOODY. He threads a needle not with thread, but with FISHING WIR and begins to STITCH the wounds closed. BLOOD POOLS on th cement floor around his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GUN & SPORT WORLD - MOMENTS LATER Trench coat and a shirt back on, Michael races along the ENDLESS RACKS OF GUNS, searching for just the right weapo his every movement precise, as if he's trained his whole for this. Weapon after ferocious weapon gets tossed into rifle bags Whatever this guy's preparing for, it's big. Rifle bags filled, Michael heads for the exit.   Stops co The place is locked up tight.   Metal gate over the front doors, bars over the windows.   How the hell's he going t out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two COPS, world weary, cruise through downtown. That's BURTON behind the wheel, ESTEVEZ riding shotgun. The POLICE RADIO is ABUZZ WITH ACTIVITY.      Busy night. Burton stares out at the city's rain soaked denizens with deep hatred, the shadows looming in doorways, the streetwalkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn' animals. Nights like this I wish I could take a match to this city just so I could watch all these motherfuckers burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) A good ol' boy barbecue, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton doesn't even smile.       He's dead fucking seriou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fresh start. That's what this place needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds his finger up like a pistol. Aims it at the peop they pass, picking them off one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pow!   Pow!     Pow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Burton laughs, a dark, mean laugh.      Estevez eyes partner, wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... You know Burton, I'm so happy we get to share beautiful moments like this. They really brighten my da--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM! Through the WINDSHIELD, we see a storefront EXPLO just ahead, raining fiery debris onto the squad car. Burton slams on the breaks and the cops look up just in t to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. GUN & SPORT WORLD - CONTINUOUS Michael, bulging rifle bags in each hand, stepping brazen out of the GAPING HOLE he's blown in the front of the sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estevez and Burton are already out of the squad car, crouching behind the open doors, GUNS trained on Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the bags! Hands on your head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the POP-POP of GUNFIRE. The POLICE RADIO CRACKLES with URGENT CHATTER. MANY VOICES TALKING AT ONCE "Shots fired...Code Three...Officer down!" The cops shift about nervously, trying to stay focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing their unease:) It's starting. There isn't much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops shoot a quick, anxious glance at each other -- " the hell?" -- then they turn back to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up and drop the bags now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael lets the gun bags hit the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands on your head!    On your head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael slowly places his palms on his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around! Turn the fuck around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael slowly turns around.    Calm. Estevez rushes in to restrain Michael, grabbing his wrist FINGERS TIGHTENING. Michael closes his eyes, a terrible decision made. And that's when he moves, a fucking blur! In an instant Michael's broken the cop's arm, spinning hi helplessly around, turning him into a human shield. Now i Michael who's in charge, gun to Estevez's head, facing of with Burton. Burton struggles to find a shot, can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let `em go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the shot, Burton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said let `em fuckin' g-g-g-g--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Burton starts to SHAKE, the words stuck in his throat like a skipping record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE STREET LAMPS BEGIN TO FLICKER AND STROBE, adding to t confusion. Burton squeezes his eyes shut in pain, his WHOLE BODY QUAKING, heels CLICKING the pavement, as if some massive pressure were building inside him. And with the horrific sound of CRACKING BONES, BURTON'S M

dialogues.speaker: CLOWN
dialogues.text: His eyes SNAP OPEN, focused, the force inside him now ful in control. Burton looks at Michael with calm recognition, his voice GUTTURAL..INHUMAN. A man possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Michael?   These weren't your orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Estevez looks at his partner with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, however, seems to know exactly who he's talking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm following my own orders now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you will die along with the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burton, you fuckin' know this guy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Burton shoots his partner in the head. Estevez drop leaving Michael without cover. Burton re-aims, but Michae faster, already FIRING back. Bullets rip up the concrete. SMASH!   The squad car windo SHATTERS, Burton's chest EXPLODING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And down he GOES, leaving Michael the only one left stand Smoke rising from his gun. With soldier-like efficiency, Michael picks up the rifle and begins to load them into the trunk of the squad car. He gets in the car and FLOORS IT, ROARING AWAY, as the

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERING STREET LAMPS FINALLY GO OUT IN RAPID SUCCESSIO
dialogues.text: wave chasing him, PLUNGING THE ENTIRE CITY INTO DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: JEEP HANSON, (LATE TEENS)
dialogues.text: Bolts awake.   Breathing hard.   Covered with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep switches on a lamp, illuminating this incredibly cra bedroom. Not much larger than the bed itself. He's got shaggy hair, a sensitive face, clearly not big on sunligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of ancient SILVERSTREAM TRAILERS are bathed in t eerie blue light of night's final moments. It looks like trailers haven't moved from this patch of barren ground i decades. A single strand of colored Christmas lights dot trailers roof lines, marking the season. One of the trailer doors CREAKS open and Jeep steps weari out into the cool western morning. Home. Nothing but desert for miles in all directions, save for two lane HIGHWAY and a weather beaten TRUCK STOP DINER th Jeep and his father will open for business in a few hours Jeep gazes up to the diner's slanted roof where a large s glows like a beacon in the darkness:

dialogues.speaker: "PARADISE FALLS GAS
dialogues.text: A beat as Jeep contemplates the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Jeep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep turns to see CHARLIE, a very pregnant girl of about twenty, standing in the trailer doorway, rubbing the slee from her eyes. Even with the trailer-trash veneer, she's strikingly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to wake you, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping out of the trailer, hands on her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't you. He's been kickin' up a storm all night. Must know somethin' I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approaches Jeep.   Sees the strain in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles for a moment, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just stress, Jeep, that's all. You do too much worryin'. About this place. About your dad. (BEAT) About me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimmer of a smile crosses Jeep's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only thing I like worrying about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I mean? You're worried about a girl eight months pregnant and it isn't even your baby. Now that's enough to give anybody nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep turns away, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, make fun of me. Everybody else does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns him back around) C'mon, I was only kiddin'. You know how much I appreciate everything you and Bob are doing for me, but a month from now, this baby'll have a new family and I'll have to start thinkin' about what the hell I'm doin' with my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not news Jeep wants to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're still going through with it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep, I'm not ready to be a mama. Christ, I can barely take care of myself as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could help you. We could do it together, you know? I want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie smiles sadly at him, touched by his sweetness, bu this just isn't where she's at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop carryin' the weight of the world on your shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep nods, tries to hide the fact that he's dying inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing her arms) Now can we go back in? I'm freezing my ass off out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.   I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie kisses him on the cheek and heads back to the trailer. He watches her, longing in his eyes. With the clank of the door, she's gone. And over Jeep's troubled look, the perennial holiday chee FRANK CAPRA'S "IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE" MIXES up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know whether I like it very much being seen around with an angel without any wings.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE PLAYING ON A CRUMMY TV
dialogues.text: Jimmy Stewart as George Bailey has just met Clarence, his guardian angel-in-training. The signal ROLLS and SNOWS in and out. We hear a WHACK, which causes the image to momentarily improve and then slowly roll back the other w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I've got to earn them and you'll help me, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB HANSEN (late 40's), owner and proprietor of this fine roadside establishment, attempts to fix the old TV hangin the corner above the counter by banging the shit out it. The restaurant itself has the kind of grungy diner charm you'd hope to find in a place last renovated in 1963. An plastic Christmas tree strung with flickering lights and tinsel occupies a lonely corner. Next to that, a faded diorama of the NATIVITY SCENE. The kind you might order o the Shopping Network. Bob considers the TV with a frown. He deftly rolls an ENGRAVED SILVER ZIPPO back and forth over the nicotine stained fingers of his right hand. Must be a nervous habi You can tell just by looking at the man that he's a beer drinker. Behind the counter, a black man named PERCY WALKER (60's) cooking up a storm on the grill with spectacular one-hand dexterity. You do get pretty good at this sort of thing w your other hand has long been replaced by a METAL HOOK. dog tags around his neck tell the story. His white cook's hat has been temporarily replaced by a red Santa hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord as my witness, Bob, one of these days that thing's gonna hit you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya talkin' about, Percy? We got a special relationship here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they got names for that kind a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUKEBOX on the other side of the diner starts up with MERLE HAGGARD tune "I'M A LONESOME FUGITIVE". A stunning looking sixteen-year-old GIRL with dyed-black and a piercing or three, is leaning seductively over the jukebox, swaying gently to the music. The headband doubli as her mini-skirt reveals her knock-out figure in a way t really doesn't leave much up to the imagination. She's a billboard of rebellion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. It is disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the scintillating action from a booth across the diner is a conservatively dressed SUBURBAN COUPLE. SANDRA and HOWARD ANDERSON. Fish out of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, how can she go out in public wearing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why don't we just ask her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard, don't. You'll embarrass me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting across the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey, honey? Your mother was wondering if you got dressed this morning with the specific intention of showing your ass off to the entire world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl who we now know as AUDREY ANDERSON turns to Howa with a caustic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's cuz I woke up hoping to get double teamed by a couple of meth head truckers in the bathroom of some desert shithole. (BEAT) Good thing we stopped here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that she turns back to the jukebox. Percy watche the exchange discreetly from behind the counter. Loving i Howard turns back to his wife.   Rigid smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel satisfied with that answer. I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra buries her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being punished for something, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the diner, Audrey goes back to swaying dreamily to music, which is suddenly overtaken by BASS BUMPIN' HIP-HO

dialogues.speaker: DRIFTING OVER A VAST EXPANSE OF WESTERN DESERT
dialogues.text: The noontime sun bakes the strip of highway slicing throu this barren country. A BLACK CADILLAC ESCALADE blazes a path.   HEAVY BEATS th from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stereo in this rig could shake mountains. KYLE WILLIA (late 20's) handsome as hell, thug style. A straight up b boy. He passes a weathered road sign:

dialogues.speaker: "ENTERING PARADISE FALLS, NEXT SERVICES 50 MILES"
dialogues.text: Kyle's expression says this is not good news. He grabs his cell phone off the passenger seat.   No sign

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots the truck stop diner just up the road ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Escalade pulls off the highway and rolls to a stop at lonely row of old gas pumps. Kyle gets out and surveys the scenery with dismay. Now in the daytime we see this is truly a place time forgot. Attached to the diner is a MECHANIC'S BAY. Grease stains rusty car parts litter the ground. Behind the place is th SILVERSTREAM TRAILER we saw Jeep step out of earlier. The only thing here that looks fairly new is the UHAUL TR parked in front of the garage with its hood up. Kyle grabs a crumpled hand drawn map from the front seat flattens it out on the roof of the car. He spins it aroun Which way is north?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren, your fuckin' directions suck, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his cell phone again. No chance of a signal way out here. So he shuffles around to the side of the diner search of a pay phone. The good news is that he finds one.   The bad news is tha it's been broken for ten years. Leaning next to the broken phone, however, is Charlie wea a shabby, faded WAITRESS uniform stretched tight around h very pregnant belly. Adding to her perfect mother-to-be l is that cigarette dangling from her lips. The plastic nam tag pinned to her chest says "CHARLIE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eyes him, mildly intrigued, takes a drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that shit right there ain't good for the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets out a long slow exhale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I should think `bout quittin' then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold on, girl, let me bum one before you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can buy a whole pack inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell ya what. You let me have one of yours, and I'll give you two from the new pack you're gonna sell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She considers him for a moment, then pulls out a cigarett Lights it off the end of hers then hands it to him. Kyle takes a drag, pulls out his crumpled map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in the right place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peers at the map) Only if nowhere's right, `cause that's where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonuvabitch. There another phone around here? You know, one that works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob'll probably let you use the diner phone if you ask him real nice...And pay `im somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle that.   You got pancakes here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we got a buttermilk stack for three seventy-five. We also got french toast for four dollars if you're into that. I personally like the pancakes though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn to see Jeep behind the diner, wearing mechanic's coveralls and holding a DUSTY OLD CRIB. Charli quickly hides her cigarette behind her back. Busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay. This guy's just lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep nods, uncertain, eyes Kyle another moment, then he shuffles along out of sight. Charlie brings the cigarette back up to her lips. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three seventy-five, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR JINGLES.   Charlie and Kyle enter. Audrey's eyes light up when she sees Kyle. He notices her well. How couldn't he? She's directing every ounce of sex appeal she has in his direction. Her parents, on the other hand, shoot a look of utter fea Kyle's direction, as if he personified their worst suburb nightmare. Charlie heads to the register. Digs out a fresh pack of smokes from underneath the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope Salem Lights are okay, `cause that's all we got left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can smoke `em, I'll take `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ya been, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob steps off the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't a resort you know.    I got orders stacking up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In truth there aren't any orders stacking up, but it certainly makes Bob feel better to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees the two cigarettes Kyle's handing her) You best not be smokin' again.    Not in your condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to the diner) Bob, do you see where am I right now? Can my condition really get any worse? `Sides, you ain't one to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   I quit two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so why you still carryin' that fancy lighter `round for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a gift from my ex-wife, alright? I'm sentimental. I don't wanna forget how much I hate her guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob turns to Kyle.   Doesn't like what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your phone? My cell doesn't get a signal out here and the pay phone outside is busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob is about to respond when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard approaches, oblivious to the conversation he's interrupting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any news about when our truck might be fixed? You said your boy would have us on the road two hours ago. The rate we're going, we'll be lucky to make it to Scottsdale by Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's expression darkens at this news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. Where the hell is Jeep?

dialogues.speaker: A GRIMY PIECE OF WOOD
dialogues.text: A cloth wipes away the dirt, revealing the partial image an ANGEL carved into the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep is carefully cleaning the old wooden crib on a workbench. There's an unsettling intensity in his eyes, a if fear itself were driving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Leonardo...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep freezes, knows he's in trouble He reluctantly turns see his father standing next to the Anderson's broken-dow Uhual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that this truck's hood's up mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep stares at the ground.   Couldn't be anymore uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaches, peering past him to the crib)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB (cont'd) Whaddya workin' on that's so goddamn important you're not doin' your job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep tries feebly to block his path, fails. Bob looks down at the crib with dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it under a bunch of stuff in the storage shed. I know you never like to throw anything away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob considers him, softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep, I like Charlie. I do. And I think it's real good of you to lend her a helping hand, but she is not your responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard this before, pushes past him) Oh whatever, leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't walk away from me while I'm talkin' to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep walks out toward the gas pumps, but Bob's right alongside him, not giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you gonna follow her around like a puppy dog? Cleanin' up the messes she makes while she steps out with every guy around here other than you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep stiffens.   Turns to his father:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that about her!     She's not like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gives Jeep a hard stare.    Yeah, she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think she's gonna stick around here after that baby's born and off her hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeps shakes his head, burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know it doesn't make any sense to you, but it's just something I have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sighs, feels for his boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points up at the PARADISE FALLS sign) See that up there? Your mother thought I was crazy for wanting to buy this place, middle of nowhere...But I just knew this was what I was supposed to do. Told your mom, "just wait." Told her when they finally ran the freeway through here like they were plannin' on, this place would be like Grand Central Station. (BEAT) But I was wrong. The freeway never came and now the only people who ever stop here are the ones who are lost. (BEAT) And your mom? Well she got tired of waitin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Dad. You can't blame yourself for what she did--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can. And I'm sayin' you're about to make the same damn mistake I made, believing in something that's never gonna happen...Or someone. (BEAT) It's time for you to move on from this place, Jeep. I don't wanna see you wake up one morning old and pissed off, realizing you're lost just like everybody else who stops here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep looks up at his father, his words hanging heavily. tough pill to swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get to work on that truck. I wanna have these people on the road by nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks back into the diner. Jeep is about to turn back to the garage when he notices something off in the distance. Ominous DARK CLOUDS line the horizon to the south like a living wall. He shifts his gaze up the highway to the nor Same thing. DARK CLOUDS are pushing their way over the distant mountains. A storm is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob reenters the diner to find Kyle sitting at the counte digging into a plate of banana pancakes. Kyle is about to address him again, when something else steals Bob's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up a silencing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV has gone on the fritz again.   Only now the image mostly snow. Bob climbs back onto the chair.   Faces the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you today?

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: The image flickers but doesn't improve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to get the satellite TV. But you don't wanna listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do I need that crap for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: History Channel, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got all the history I can take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this was the top-of-the- line model when I bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in the Fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be watchin' anyways. (rubs his hands together) Okay, baby, this is gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob gives the TV one final wallop -- WHACK! And the picture snaps into FOCUS.    Only it isn't the pi he was expecting. The STARK GRAPHIC OF THE EMERGENCY BROADCASTING SYSTEM an its accompanying HOLLOW TONE fill the diner. Everybody in the place stops and turns to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?   Clear as day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Bob. What the hell's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just one of those test things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be true, except for the words at the bottom of the screen, which read:

dialogues.speaker: "THIS IS NOT A TEST"
dialogues.text: Bob switches the channels.    All the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look like a test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob steps off the chair and backs slowly away from the TV if a little distance will bring some clarity. He bumps in Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, am I the Invisible motherfuckin' Man here?    Do you have a phone or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle peels a five dollar bill off a serious WAD OF CASH. That gets Bob's attention. Bob snaps the money out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back past the kitchen.   Make it fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle hustles passed Percy. Charlie is standing by the Anderson's table, clearing dis Everybody's eyes are locked on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's a real emergency aren't they supposed to give us some information about what to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Percy, give that old radio of yours a shot. Maybe they got some news about the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy grabs an old battery powered radio off a kitchen sh Switches it on. STATIC.   He spins the dial until he reaches a clear sign The same HOLLOW TONE of Emergency Broadcasting.   Station after station the same thing. The diner is overwhelmed by a chilling chorus of HOLLOW TONES. Everyone goes very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle sits at a messy desk in this dark, wood paneled back office, phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Cuz a father should be able to talk to his son, that's why. Now put `im on the phone. (a beat then a smile) Is that my little man...? Yeah, well I'm working hard, so that I can be with you. You bein' good? (strange STATIC can be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... You're breakin' up. Hello...? (hangs up in frustration) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle stews a beat, then picks up the phone to redial. Frowns. No dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps trying.    Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there was an earthquake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is looking at Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep sayin' we're overdue for a big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot a folks could be hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if it was centered in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.    Could be nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then why's the TV out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it just hit the relay stations. Aren't those usually in remote areas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, `cause of the radiation they give off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ain't no radiation comin' from those things. Plus that don't explain the radio being out too. Some of those stations broadcast over hundreds of miles. Any quake that big and we would a felt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy's right. I didn't feel nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a terrorist attack or something...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covers her mouth) Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone considers that grimly, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for cryin' out loud. There's no use in speculating. I'll just call my brother up in Needles. He must a heard something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle has reappeared in the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone's dead. Just tried to make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shittin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle shakes his head, sits down at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Mrs. Anderson. Nothing to get excited about. Probably just working on the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB (cont'd) Sides, I'm sure Jeep'll have your truck fixed up quick as can be, and then you'll be on your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep is buried under the Uhaul's hood, working at somethi with a socket wrench. It's not going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself up. Grease covers his face and hands. sound of a CAR APPROACHING catches his attention. He watches as a beat up EIGHTIES CUTLASS SUPREME pulls of the highway and rolls to a stop at the pumps. It's a myst how anyone could see through the LAYER OF DUST on that windshield. After a moment the car door pops open and the LEGS OF AN ELDERLY WOMAN swing down to the ground, followed by the m frame and wheels of a walker. The LITTLE OLD LADY gets out of the car, steadies herself the walker, and then slowly makes her way toward the dine with the rickety frailness of an old turtle. Jeep watches her disappear inside. He then looks toward the horizon again.   The WALL OF DAR CLOUDS are growing ever closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JINGLE as the old lady enters. She surveys the scene as feasting on paradise. Maybe her eyes aren't so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat wherever you want, Ma'am. Specials are on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old lady settles at a table across from the Andersons She smiles at them pleasantly. Charlie is about to hand her a menu, when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I already know what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what'll it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have the steak, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how'd you like that cooked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rare if you would. And water, no ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an unusual name for a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they say. I'll be right back with your water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old lady turns to the Andersons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I'm Gladys. Gladys Foster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Gladys. I'm Sandra and this is my husband Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nice young couple you are. What brings you out to these parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving out to Scottsdale. But our truck broke down, and so we're stuck here while it's being fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what a nuisance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLY begins to buzz around Gladys's head.    She doesn't to notice it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Gladys, it seems the lines are down around here. The phone and TV, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDRA (cont'd) And I just was wondering if you might have heard something on your way up? You know, about what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys smiles strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry yourself about that, sweetheart. It'll all be over soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra nods at the old woman, unsure of what to make of t response. The fly that was circling her head, now lands on GLADYS'S FACE. It crawls across her cheek without her reacting in least. Howard and Sandra exchange looks.    Creepy. The door JINGLES and Jeep walks in. He heads straight for quiet huddle with Bob. All the while though, he keeps one eye fixed on the old lady sitting at the table near the Andersons. Something about her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carburetor's shot.    Don't know why. Looks brand new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances over at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shit. They're gonna be pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could try to rebuild it, but it'd take a while, and I don't think we have all the parts. If we call right now, we might be able to get a new one down here tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna happen.    Goddamn phone's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the diner, Charlie places a bloody red steak in fr of Gladys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, dear. How far along are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie rests a hand on her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father must be very proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of sight. Out of mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see.     So you're not married, I take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fly lands on Gladys's steak. Charlie tries to wave it away. But another one lands in its place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys starts to dig in to the steak with a real ferociousness you wouldn't expect from an old lady.   Mor FLIES begin to land on her body. On her food. Charlie is still trying to wave them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I prefer it that way. I don't a need a man tellin' me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's gonna burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie freezes. The Andersons turn to look as well.   Ky glances over from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all smiles) I said your fucking baby's gonna burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie shakes her head at the woman, not giving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps the check down on the table and walks back towa the kitchen, passing Jeep and Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total fucking Jesus freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys begins to laugh innocently as she continues to dev her meat. Red juice drips down her chin. The flies are swarming now. How did so many get in here? Sandra and Howard are mortified at this sudden turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those babies.    They're gonna burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys, please. There's no reason to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys's head suddenly whips toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you stupid fucking cunt! All you do is complain! Complain! Complain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra covers her mouth in shock.    Everybody in the din now focused on the old lady. Howard gets up from the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard, it's okay!     Don't listen to her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Howard's already standing over Gladys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you are, lady?! Now, I'd like you to apologize to my --

dialogues.speaker: RAZOR SHARP TEETH.
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY FREAKS as Howard crumbles to the floor. Gladys rockets to her feet, knocking her table over.   Bl covers her face and chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all going to fucking die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy is the first to react. From behind the counter, he whips a heavy metal frying pan at Gladys that knocks her sideways. THWACK! BONES BREAK AND BURST FROM HER NECK.   Impossibly, Gladys still standing. She lets out an INHUMAN SCREAM and SCRAMBLES ACROSS THE DINER, knocking tables and chairs over in her wake. Bob pulls a shotgun from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gladys not only moves, SHE SCURRIES RIGHT UP THE FUCK

dialogues.speaker: WALL LIKE SOME KIND OF BIZARRE CRAB
dialogues.text: Bob can't believe his eyes. But he gets over it real fast as the crab lady rushes toward him -- ACROSS THE CEILING

dialogues.speaker: UPSIDE DOWN
dialogues.text: BOB PUMPS THE SHOTGUN, trying to take her down, but he ca track her fast enough. Instead he blows ENORMOUS HOLES in the ceiling, a rain of plaster. Gladys drops down right in front of Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggles to cock the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys smiles sweetly before SLAPPING HIM CLEAR ACROSS TH

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: The shotgun clatters to the floor at Jeep's feet. He snatches it up and aims it at Gladys who turns calmly to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot her, Jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep's about to fire, when the old lady's EYES GO ALL WHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sickly sweet smile) You'll never save her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep freezes, stunned by her words, overwhelming fear paralyzing him where he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOT THE FUCKING BITCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys rockets straight at him! But Jeep's too afraid to move.    He clamps his eyes shut bracing himself for the end.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: A RAIN OF BULLETS RIP INTO GLADYS, taking her down like a animal. Jeep slowly opens his eyes.   His gun's still cocked. Gladys lies dead in a smoldering, bloody heap at his feet He turns to see Kyle with smoke rising from the barrel of silver plated WESTERN ARMS 45. If everyone wasn't so shocked, they'd probably be wondering why this guy is pac such serious heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra is on the floor with her husband.     Blood pours from his neck. Kyle stares at the dying man -- a moment of hesitation -- then he rushes to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press your hands over the hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra looks fearfully up at Kyle, at the gun still in hi hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like that, lady! I'm tryin' to fuckin' help you! Now put your goddamn hands over the hole before your husband bleeds to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obeying, she cups her hands over the hole in his neck, desperately trying to stop the flow of blood leaking out between her fingers. Percy scrambles over with a first-ai kit and together he and Kyle get to work on Howard's neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few feet away, Charlie helps Bob, bruised and bleeding, his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck was that?!   What the fuck was that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the diner, Audrey is pushed back into a booth, her knees pulled tightly to her chest, shivering. Her adult facade giving way to that of a frightened child A DROP OF RED HITS AUDREY'S CHEEK, causing her to look up see Gladys's TRAIL OF BLOOD DRIPPING FROM THE CEILING. An ungodly horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, Percy, Sandra and Audrey frantically carry Howard, neck bandaged, to the back of the Escalade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard lies in the back seat. Sandra by his head, claspin his hands in hers. Audrey by his feet. Percy rides shotgu Kyle struggles to get the key in the ignition. The engine ROARS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Escalade fishtails onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle grips the wheel.   Picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy, maybe eighty miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle shoots him a look. Eighty miles?! Pedal to the floor time. Audrey leans forward from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that on the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the DARK CLOUDS Jeep saw earlier have finally closed in, descending onto the highway like a WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fuckin' clouds!   What the fuck do they look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not clouds. Clouds don't buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right.    They're black... Undulating... BUZZING!

dialogues.speaker: PING
dialogues.text: Suddenly HUNDREDS OF TINY BUGS begin to HIT the windshiel

dialogues.speaker: SPLAT
dialogues.text: And that's when they realize it... Those aren't clouds.

dialogues.speaker: THEY'RE FLIES
dialogues.text: The Escalade enters the SWARM. The car is PUMMELED by insects, the windshield instantly covered in BLACK AND RE bug guts. Driving blind! The sound of FLIES SPLATTERING and BUZZING is deafening! Everyone SCREAMS as hell surrounds them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob is hunched over the steaming sink, pounding a can of light beer. Jeep is leaning against the wall, looking lik he's about to puke or faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand how she was still standin' after Percy hit `er with that goddamn fryin' pan. Broke her fuckin' neck. I saw it. I swear I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you see that kid's gun? The hell's he doin' with a gun like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks over at Jeep, sees him trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Jeep.   It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for Jeep it's not okay.   He's hurting real bad insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't pull the trigger. I froze. I saw what I needed to do, but I was afraid... (breaks down) She could've killed you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEEP (cont'd) Or Charlie...She would've killed me if it wasn't for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't get the words out.   Bob rests a hand on his boy shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' to be ashamed of, Jeep. (BEAT) Not everybody can play the hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jeep can respond, they hear the sound of the front DOOR JINGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Jeep appear from the back, as Kyle, Percy, Audrey Sandra carry Howard into the diner, all of them stumbling gasping for air. Charlie moves in to help. Percy races for the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching Percy by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get my bible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you need that for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well somebody's gotta start prayin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's about to respond when he hears the BUZZING. Bob, Charlie and Jeep slowly approach the windows to see

dialogues.speaker: STOP'S PERIMETER A FEW HUNDRED YARDS OUT.
dialogues.text: Everything in the diner is suddenly cast in DARK RED as t day's remaining sunlight filters through the swarm. Apocalyptic. No one breathes.

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK HAND AND A HOOK TEAR A SHIRT OPEN
dialogues.text: Revealing a bloody mess of muscles and tendons chewed dow the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy and Charlie are tending to Howard. Sandra is holdin her husband's hand, trying to comfort him, while Audrey watches from a distance with grim fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises a bottle of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hold `em steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, peakish, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, please don't throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard writhes as Percy pours alcohol on the wound. Sandra can't help but stare at Percy's hook. Meanwhile across the diner, Bob and Jeep peel back the tablecloth to examine Gladys' bullet riddled corpse. Kyle stands over them with Bob's shotgun trained on the body - just in case. Gladys is a real horror show. Bones jut out at obtuse ang from her neck -- a result of the blow to her head from Percy's frying pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cold as a freakin' ice cube. If I hadn't just seen her walk in here, I'd say the old bag's been dead for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob rolls Gladys over, revealing her face -- her enlarged mouth filled with dozens of razor sharp baby teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't care how long she's been dead, the bitch ain't stayin' in here with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, Kyle and Jeep quickly drag Gladys's body wrapped in plastic table cloth a short ways from the diner. They war eye the curtain of FLIES no more than a hundred yards out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.    Why don't they come closer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck am I supposed to know, man? You askin' me to explain the behavior of a motherfuckin' pestilence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLANK and Jeep notices the old lady's car keys have dro to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the keys) You guys!

dialogues.speaker: GLADYS' CUTLASS SUPREME
dialogues.text: Its windows are completely caked with dust. The men WIPE AWAY a layer of brown from the glass, allowing them to pe inside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Twilight Zone shit if that's what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep slips the key into the driver's side door.     Unloc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. Old lady could have some kind of rabid poodle locked up in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep slowly swings the door open and that's when the smel hits them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agh!   What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob covers his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle opens the passenger door, looks in.      Dark, dirty nothing unusual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout the trunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go around to the BACK OF THE CAR.   Jeep slips the k in. The trunk POPS open, revealing a PILE OF DEAD CATS.   ROT MAGGOT INFESTED. Bob quickly slams the trunk closed.    The guys are reeli with disgust. Kyle's trying to blow the stench from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch's got motherfuckin' dead cats in her hoopty! What the fuck is wrong with white people?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least now we know where that smell was coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was a real motherfuckin' necessity we figured that out, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees something up the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see HEADLIGHTS growing larger in the dim haz A POLICE CRUISER careens off the highway and skids to a w stop in front of the diner. Its ENGINE RATTLES as the dus clears around it. No movement can be seen behind its bug splattered windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now we're talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Check it out. It's LAPD. What's an LA cop doing way out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Jeep look over at Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Nevada, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They consider the police car a moment more. See the SHATTERED PASSENGER WINDOW, the BLOOD STAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle hands the shotgun over to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's face lights up when she sees the police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God, the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the POLICE CAR OPENS as Charlie races from th diner. The three men see her moving toward the car.    Jeep's fa goes slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men begin to run toward her... While out of the police car steps...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Charlie freezes a few feet from the car when she sees tho piercing eyes already familiar to us. Michael looks at he as if she was exactly who he expected to see. In moments Bob, Kyle and Jeep form a protective shield in front of Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take one step closer and I'll drop you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as Michael considers Bob.   Icy cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That how you greet all your customers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, after what we've been through here today, you're lucky we didn't shoot you first and greet you later. Now let me see your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stares at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your teeth goddamn it!       Lemme see `em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael offers up a dangerous smile, revealing a not so w kept but definitely normal set of teeth. Bob and the othe ease slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, shark teeth, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Suppose you tell us your name then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about all that, Michael. This old lady just went crazy inside my place here. She had these teeth. Never seen anything like `em. Practically bit a man in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael remains silent.       Doesn't seemed shocked in t by what he's heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doin' out here? Gotta say you don't exactly look like a police officer. Even one from L.A. Then again, you have to be, right? I mean, who the hell'd be crazy enough to steal a cop car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob chuckles for a moment. When Michael doesn't respond i kind, Bob falls silent. Anxious. He slowly raises the shotgun again. Michael sizes up this raggedy group. His gaze drifts over the loosely wrapped body in front of the diner. The plast table cloth flaps wildly in the wind. Turning back to Bob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know anything. Nothing's working here. The TV, the radio, the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael steps toward Charlie with a sense of purpose, but blocks his path, brandishing the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, fella... (BEAT) Now, I don't care if this is the second coming of Jesus fucking Christ, I say it's time for you to either get talkin' or get the hell outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a BLUR OF MOVEMENT, Michael rips the shotgun from Bob' hands. It all happens so fast that Bob is stunned to find himself holding air. He's even more stunned to now have the barrel of the gun pressed to the bridge of his nose. Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy!   Easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's expression is totally calm.   Merciless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Dad, tell `em you're sorry. Tell `em you were only kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bob can't even speak, he's so scared.   He squeezes h eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let `em go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's eyes flit momentarily in Charlie's direction. Considering her. The diner door opens and Percy steps cautiously out with and hook held up to show no threat. He's followed by Sand and Audrey. Michael sees them, but offers no indication that he cares

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, son, I'm sure you don't wanna go spillin' blood for no good reason in front of all these decent people, do ya? Our friend Bob here ain't worth the trouble it'd cause ya. (BEAT) So whaddya say `bout just lettin' `im go and then you can be on your way? Nice `n' easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Michael doesn't seem to register this plea.   It's no looking good. No one BREATHES. That's when Kyle notices something out i the direction of the road. DOZENS OF TINY HEADLIGHTS APPEARING IN THE DARK HAZE. APPROACHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns, sees the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob's looks down at the gun, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser. Pops it, revealing a staggering ARSENAL OF WEAPONRY. HE BEGINS TO LOAD GUN AFTER GUN. Percy stares out at the lights, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, have mercy. (waving back Audrey and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ladies best get back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's happening? Who is this man? Why's he driving a police car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey pulls her mother back into the diner. Michael hands an MP5 SUB-MACHINE GUN to Kyle. Another one goes to Percy. Finally he places a third one in Jeep's hands, who stares down at it anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I don't think that's such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) He's just a kid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, I can handle it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's eyes narrow, studying Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can handle it. He doesn't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pulls out twin MP5s for himself. GLOCK 9s are tuc everywhere they can go. Michael tosses clip belts to the men. Boxes of shotgun shells. The works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to live, you'll do exactly as I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the trunk closed and approaches Charlie.   He co Glock and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you fire, you keep your thumb off the slide. Don't hesitate. Don't do anything brave. There's no safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a hard look.   She nods nervously.   Trustin but not sure why. Michael marches into the diner. Kyle glances quickly at t others, then he bolts after Michael. Percy follows.   Then Charlie. Now it's only Jeep and his father left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jeep. We gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bob rushes into the diner. A moment as Jeep looks out toward the road. THE HEADLIGHTS ARE GROWING BRIGHTER.       CLOSER. He contemplates the sub-machine gun in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And races after his father.

dialogues.speaker: A DEAD BOLT
dialogues.text: Thrown.   Locking the diner door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic activity. Kyle and Michael push a booth in front the door, sealing off the entrance. Tables are turned on their sides to form makeshift shield Window blinds are snap closed.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK OFFICE
dialogues.text: Jeep races in, locks the back door.       Then he pushes front of it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DINER
dialogues.text: The place is transformed. Locked up tight.        The ROA ENGINES outside grows ever LOUDER, CLOSER. Sandra huddles on the floor with Howard, his head in her She's running her hands gently through his hair, trying t keep calm. He opens his eyes. Pale, weak from blood loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra?    What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay!     Everything's okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra closes her eyes.        Struggling to believe it. Suddenly the ELECTRICITY GOES OUT, dipping the room into DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear CRIES OF ALARM.   TOTAL BLACK.   Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep, get the flashlights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody just stay still!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that we're locked in here, what the fuck are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker of LIGHT. And then FLASHLIGHT BEAMS CUT THROUGH THE DARKNESS...coming to rest on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatch opens and out comes Michael followed by Bob, Perc and Kyle. They quickly take their places behind the "Paradise" sign. Pitch black surrounds them. The RUMBLE OF ENGINES is gone, leaving only the RUSH OF T WIND coming up off the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob turns to Michael sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Rambo. You got us up here. Now you mind explaining what the fuck we're fighting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is about to answer, when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the wind, another sound becomes audible. The delicate chime of a CALLIOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what I'm hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...The hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CALLIOPE MUSIC grows louder, the melody more distinct Now we recognize the song: SANTA CLAUS IS COMING TO TOWN. But instead of filling them with cheer, it fills them wit dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds almost like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO HEADLIGHTS appear in the   darkness. And sure enough, ICE CREAM TRUCK rolls slowly   toward the diner. The EERI CALLIOPE MUSIC emanates from   a speaker on its roof. It' dark to see who's behind the   wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be fuckin' kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. There's a safety switch on the side of your gun. Push it all the way down. Two clicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men quickly do as they're told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now when this starts, you hold on tight, you hear me? If you don't, you're going to blow your hand off. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, Bob shoot quick anxious looks at Percy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck y'all lookin' at me for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep faces the boarded up front door, awkwardly holding t MP5, trying to assume a tough guy posture. If only he cou stop shaking, it might be believable. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows. The ICE CREAM TRUCK'S HEADLIGHTS fan across the diner. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows. Charlie stops next to Jeep. Senses him shaking. Rests a hand on his arm. And that seems to help...a little. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the CALLIOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, listen.    It's the Ice Cream Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ice Cream Truck pulls to a stop with its headlights facing the diner. Everyone aims their guns at the truck.     Tense. From the Ice Cream Truck...a DARK BLOODY SHOE STEPS to th ground. MOVING up the long grey pant leg spotted with blood stain reveal a skeletally thin man in tattered coveralls. Say hello to THE ICE CREAM MAN. He looks like he's been through hell -- literally. As he steps into the beams of the headlights we can see him eve more clearly. He's tall. Too tall. His clothes don't seem to fit him. And he's unnaturally thin as if he's been stretched like taffy. If he got down on all fours, you might mistake him for some kind of spider. He surveys the diner, the garage the roof -- assessing the situation. On the roof, the men wait for something to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS) Ah, he don't look that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ice Cream Man's gaze snaps up to the roof.      He he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.     Oh, shit.   Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the Ice Cream Man's JAW UNHINGES, STRETCHING

dialogues.speaker: TORTUROUSLY DOWN TO NEARLY THE MIDDLE OF HIS CHEST
dialogues.text: AFTER ROW OF A RAZOR SHARP TEETH FORM with the sickening sound of CRACKING OF BONES. From his new mouth, the Ice Cream Man lets out an earth shattering HOWL. Everyone except Michael is practically hyperventilating w fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the ICE CREAM MAN BOLTS for the diner with STARTLING SPEED! His movements aren't at all like those of a normal man, but rather like some kind of HUMAN INSECT. Michael aims.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Bullets rip into the creature's body, knocking him flat o his back. Still. Arms and legs in a twisted, twitching mess. Michael keeps his aim.    Waits.   The CALLIOPE music con to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close. A RUMBLING OF ENGINES. HEADLIGHTS. A freeway full of VEHICLES of every variety punch through t wall of dust, racing toward the diner. They are THE COMMUTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!   Shoot now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men let loose with FEROCIOUS FIREPOWER.

dialogues.speaker: WINDSHIELDS SHATTER
dialogues.text: Vehicles swerve and COLLIDE! DARK SHAPES bolt from the burning vehicles, scattering. In the FLASH OF BATTLE we catch glimpses of them: BUSINES

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE. CONSTRUCTION WORKERS. EVEN AN ENTIRE HIGH SCHOOL
dialogues.text: FOOTBALL TEAM. All deformed by some demonic force. Many mere BALLS OF FLAME drifting through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread out! Don't let them get close to the windows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DARK SHAPES converge on the diner from all directions They move so strangely fast it seems that their feet don' actually touch the ground. From the roof it's a full-on turkey shoot as the men foll Michael's instructions and cut down everything in sight. Their faces lighting up with each FLASH. SHELL CASINGS spray from their weapons like water drops f a sprinkler. BODIES BURST and crumble to the dirt. The creatures don't seem to be afraid of dying. Their strategy appears to be their sheer numbers. With each wave, the dark figures get ever closer to the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BOB firing madly.    Then...   CLICK!   CLICK!   Oh, n out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shells!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy tosses him a box of shells. But Bob fumbles the cat and the box slides halfway down the sloped roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the gun still in one hand, Bob reaches frantically d for the ammo. Stretching... Further...

dialogues.speaker: A HIDEOUSLY WOUNDED MIDDLE-AGED HOUSEWIFE CATAPULTS UP FR
dialogues.text: BELOW THE ROOFLINE! Her hair must have been in curlers before most of it BURNED AWAY. Her nightdress hangs in tatters off her body. Her jaw CLICKS RAPIDLY, as she clatters up at Bob like a GIANT INSECT. Bob tries to pull back, but he has no traction and he sta to slip down toward her. She's coming fast! Percy sees his friend in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob swings the shotgun like a club -- CRACK! -- knocking bitch clear off the roof. But the move has made his slide even faster. He drops the shotgun, trying to hold on, but can't stop!

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIM
dialogues.text: She doesn't even have a chance to react as Bob does somet akin to a swimmer's push right off her body! WHAM! The creature goes flying back off the roof and the opposi force halts Bob's slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hook) Grab my hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob reaches up and clasps Percy's hook, praying that it s on. But this chick ain't finished yet. Up she comes once more Her razor sharp fingernails claw up the metal roof. SCREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy tosses Bob a Glock. Fortunately this time Bob deftl catches it with his free hand just as the deranged woman pounces on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jamming the gun in her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! The back of her head EXPLODES. Her body goes limp. Bob struggles to push the corpse off of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull me up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy extends his hook hand, helping Bob ascend to safety

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding in the shadows... listening to sounds of WAR just outside. Sandra squeezes her hands over her ears.   A few feet awa Audrey clutches a butcher's knife. Jeep's eyes darting from one window to another.   Trying keep it together. Charlie is crouched down behind the counter, holding the handgun close to her pregnant belly. Distant EXPLOSIONS rattle the plates on the shelves. Charlie peers out from behind the counter to look at the front windows. Momentary FLASHES of intense light outline the closed bli Another FLASH lights up Charlie's face.    Staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy is swivelling left and right, firing like mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, motherfuckers!   Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer and closer the creatures come.   Most are eviscera by the fire from the rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CHARLIE staring at the window.    CLOSER.   Charlie's wide as -- SMASH!   A DARK SHAPE crashes through the window.    Glas sand and dust swirl in. Audrey and Sandra SCREAM. Charlie springs up from her hiding place, gun ready. Jeep spins around, pointing his gun, searching franticall for the intruder. It's so dark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey shakes her head, tears streaming down her cheeks. looks over at her mother. Sandra's eyes are closed. It's too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!   Open your eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!   I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Howard's body is TORN AWAY from Sandra. Somethin got hold of his legs!   That gets Sandra's eyes open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (springing after her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard screams deliriously as he's dragged rapidly throug the diner toward the broken front window. He flails about desperately trying to grab a hold of something. Sandra scrambles after her husband.   Reaching for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature reaches the window. Sandra dives for Howard' outstretched hands. She has him! The creature's progress is abruptly halted at the shatter window.   It turns back toward Sandra -- a shaft of light falling across its face, reveals: A TEENAGE GIRL of about Audrey's age.   Her skin is a dea blue. Her pupils a GHASTLY WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep human fingernail scratches have torn open the bloate flesh on her arms, neck and face. The self-inflicted woun of a drug addict. Her voice is not QUITE HUMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what you made me do, mother!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra screams, holds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Audrey rush to Sandra's side, grabbing Howard arms. Jeep is right behind them ready to fire at the creature, with the women in the way, he can't get a clear shot. So discards the gun and grabs Howard's arms. Howard screams as his body is torturously stretched.   A tug-of-war.

dialogues.speaker: CLAWS REACH THROUGH THE WINDOW AND GRAB HIS LEGS.
dialogues.text: Howard's body lurches further out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard's torso is almost entirely out the window. Charlie daringly reaches for Howard's belt, desperate to gain leverage.

dialogues.speaker: ONTO CHARLIE'S ARM
dialogues.text: Charlie screams as she's yanked painfully toward the wind losing her grip on Howard's belt. Through the broken window, she sees the face of a RAGGEDY LOOKING MAN. He smiles at her like a father coming home t his baby girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SWEETLY) There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he starts to pull her arm even harder...Other creatur suddenly notice her as well, focusing their attack as if alone was their target. Jeep immediately let's go of Howard and dives for Charlie grabbing her free arm just before she's pulled through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the help, Audrey and Sandra can't hold on any lon Howard is ripped from of his family's hands and out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!
