dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tide is turning. The men seem to have gotten their ga on and the dark shapes are starting to pull back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're running!      We got `em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle turns happily to Michael.     Gone.   Kyle looks aro roof with alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few more inches separate Charlie and certain death through the window. Jeep's losing her!

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF STEEL. SCHING
dialogues.text: Charlie and Jeep fall back into the diner, the claw like hands still grasping Charlie's arm no longer attached to their owners. Michael leaps over her, a butcher's knife in one hand, a machine gun in the other. He lights up everything in his path. The window blinds become a WALL OF FIRE. Creatures SCREECH and flee into the night, having successfully take their first victim. Charlie flings the severed appendages off her and she and Jeep scoot away from the window. Hysterical, Sandra tries to push past Michael. She's goin after Howard. He intercepts her before she can make it ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!     He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra slaps at him frantically as he carries her away fr the window and thrusts her down into a back booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...     Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charlie climbs slowly to her feet -- a sudden pain. clutches her belly. Winces. Jeep catches her arm to steady her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (RECOVERING) I'm okay. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances back at Michael.       He's watching her.   T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to do anything brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie doesn't know how to respond.      She's about to something when -- Kyle rushes into the room.       A smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got `em runnin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Kyle notices the broken window, takes in the room, h excitement falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Howard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one responds.   Sandra and Audrey are huddled together Crying. Bob and Percy follow Kyle in, still shaking from the adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone needs to be on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob grabs Kyle's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. (approaches Michael,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better start talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Michael.    These people want answers.      F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time God lost faith in Man he sent a flood. The second time...he sent what you see outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone takes that in for a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sayin' this is the Apocalypse...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying this is an extermination. (BEAT) Those things out there are vessels. The Possessed. The weakest willed are the easiest to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possessed by what?    Demons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...by angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That silences the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out his bible) Son, I don't know what bible you been readin', but in my version, the angels are the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks squarely at Percy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where your book is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you know so much about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know because until last night, I was on their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael considers Jeep, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right and yesterday I was the fuckin' Easter Bunny. You know, fuck this. I don't even believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, because He doesn't believe in you either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob stares at Michael, uncertain how to respond to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Bob. Have you looked outside recently? Those aren't exactly our regular customers out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know he didn't bring them here himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings them here and then he saves us from them? You're a genius, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob falls silent, confounded. Audrey hesitantly approaches Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're here to protect us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you... (looks at Charlie) Her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie reacts in shock, as all eyes are suddenly on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?!   Why me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because your child is the only hope humanity has of surviving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response to that, Charlie does the only thing someone do when told such a thing. She LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Michael isn't joking and Charlie's laughter becomes genuine fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STUNNED) Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep stares at Charlie, as if suddenly his entire life is starting to make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sayin' she's the mother of the Messiah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, isn't Mary supposed to be a vi--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself, Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you wonder about Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaches Michael, panic setting in) Look, this is not possible! I'm just a waitress! I'm nobody! I can't give birth to the Savior of Mankind! (and finally) I don't even own a car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of that matters anymore. Either your child lives or Mankind dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, we're supposed to just hold those things off until Mary over there squeezes one out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be. I'm only eight months pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh we're fucked.     We are so fucked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to survive here for a month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this Charlie goes white, the realization hitting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming soon, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods. Charlie sways on her feet.   Jeep rests a hand on her shoulder, steadying her. With a CLANK Michael re-arms his weapon, turns to the gro with finality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to live you'll do what I say. This first attack was a test of our strength. The next one will be a test of our weakness. (BEAT) Something much worse is on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone exchanges terrified looks.   Finally, Kyle steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what's your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll keep watch on the roof in shifts of two. Jeep, go get some tools. We need to close up this window before somebody else goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep looks anxiously at Charlie, silent, scared, and then follows after Michael, leaving Charlie to stare at the SHATTERED WINDOW, the blinds flipping wildly in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy and Kyle keep watch, rifles at their sides. They're wrapped up from head to toe in blankets to protect them f the cold and the flies. Percy scans the horizon.   Momentary SPECTRAL FLASHES dot darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out there. Sons of bitches. I can feel `em. (BEAT) Damn it's cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy makes the unconscious motion of rubbing his "hands" together to keep them warm. Kyle notices. Sees the dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the Army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navy, two tours. But the second one didn't work out so well, so I didn't get to go back for a third. Suppose that makes me lucky in a way. Served with Bob, you know. That's how I ended up in this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it like?    Being in a war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.   Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle nods. Scared. He takes out his 45.     Nervously swi it from hand to hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's with that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your piece. The one you killed grandma with. Don't reckon it's for huntin' buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I uh -- keep it for protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protection from what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy looks at him skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, people who might try to give me a hard time, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just regular people or uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, no, not regular, regular people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irregular people then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talkin' people whose job it is to give other people a hard time. Kinda person who doesn't get enough fiber in their diet, you know what I'm sayin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a work thing, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.    Strictly business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This business of yours... You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you to be sweatin' me, man? I got my reasons for doin' what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy just stares at him, penetrating.     Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid my father would sit by my bed every night before I'd go to sleep and he'd say to me, Percy, if you don't wake up tomorrow, if it turns out that today was your last day on earth, would you be proud of what you've done in this life? Cuz if you ain't, then you better start gettin' square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks at Percy, fear in his eyes, then he turns back the darkness...and the evil that surrounds them.

dialogues.speaker: THE SILVER ZIPPO
dialogues.text: rolls between dirty fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob plays with his trusty zippo with one hand and grills some steaks with the other. He pauses in his cooking ever few moments to take a slug from a can of beer. Can't get down fast enough. Sandra sits at the counter across from him, staring at a prescription bottle tipped in front of her, pills spread around. Bob glances over, sees the devastation in her eyes. He pu another can of beer from underneath the counter, pops it places it in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him.    Smiles weakly.   Takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't eat if my life depended on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I figure just cuz the world's coming to an end, it doesn't mean a man's gotta starve. All I can say is thank heavens they left the gas on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra takes another sip of beer.   Considers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never much cared for beer. Howard's the beer drinker in the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment the words leave her mouth, the grief hits her again. She gathers up some pills from the counter, tosses them back and downs her beer like there's no tomorrow. Th is a battle she's losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile in a booth across the diner, Audrey is fiddling with Percy's old radio. Back and forth on the dial. Listening for anything. Nothing but STATIC. Up at the front of the diner, Jeep silently helps Michael nail broken table planks across the shattered window. He eyes the strange tatoos running down Michael's arms, the jagged wounds visible above his shirt line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do...you know, before you came here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael considers the question a beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a soldier, a general, in His army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what changed?   What made you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was given an order I didn't believe in... (off Jeep's look:) He lost faith. I hadn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael drives the last nail into place, securing the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happens to you...after this is over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pauses a beat, as if unsure how much to say, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes we have to face the thing we fear the most in order to be free of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael picks up his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost time for the next shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to stare after h deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faintest glint of sunlight through the dark red dusty haze. A new day has forced itself into existence. TITLE:   "December 24th - 6:05am"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is searching the horizon in front of the diner fo movement. His expression focused, determined. On the other side of the roof, Bob keeps watch, strugglin stay awake. The beer taking over. His eyes droop closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra awakens with a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Howard's not there. And everyone else in the diner is still asleep. The drugs have started to wear off... and h fear is returning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra splashes water on her face.   Stares at herself in mirror. A living wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra steps out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Sandra...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra spins around.    Searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard?     Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure sounded like Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me...     Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, it's clear where the voice is coming from. turns to face the BACK DOOR. A desk blocks it. Sandra ever so slowly approaches the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from behind the door) Help me. Sandra...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra is stricken.    What the hell is she going to do? That's when Sandra notices the TRANSOM WINDOW above the d She climbs onto the desk and stretches up until she can s out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard. Her husband. Ten feet away from the door.     NAI TO AN UPSIDE-DOWN CROSS. But wait. It gets worse. His skin is covered with horribl black boils. And even worse than that. Howard's boils are breathing. Sandra goes slack with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard's torn open shirt reveals the BREATHING PUSTULES covering his body. He writhes in slow, excruciating agony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra scrambles down off the desk and frantically pushes away from the door. She's reaching for the dead bolt when Audrey and Kyle appear in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle races to restrain Sandra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!     He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that tag Kyle in the face. Down he goes. Sandra is about to open the door when Audrey pounces on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOUTING from the back office awakens the rest of the sleepers. Percy springs up. Charlie is shaking Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR OF WIND ripping off the plain is all that can be heard. ON BOB as his head drops down with drunken fatigue Sleep. RISING OVER HIM TO SEE... Howard nailed to the upside-down cross below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra and Audrey are locked in battle. Sandra slaps Audr hard. Audrey stumbles over Kyle and hits the floor. Percy appears in the doorway. Now is her last chance. Sandra whips open the back door a that's when the world hits SLOW MOTION. Howard is there.    A few feet away.   Alive. Sandra races toward him.    Just behind her comes Percy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when the speed ACCELERATES TO NORMAL -- -- and the boils covering Howard's body explode -- sprayi streams of dark fluid toward Sandra -- -- just at the moment Percy spins around her, shielding h from the spray, which hits him in the back. But he's not stopping. Percy pushes Sandra back into the diner, the do SLAMMING closed behind them. Percy releases Sandra, letting her stumble hysterically i the room. Kyle and Jeep grab her, forcing her to the grou But she's not fighting anymore. Charlie turns to look at Percy who is still standing with back to the door, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a step forward, then falls to ground. The entire back side of his body is gone.      Burned awa

dialogues.speaker: A SHEET
dialogues.text: covering a body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy's body lies covered on the table. Bob stares rueful at his dead friend. A broken man. Tears stream down his face. He rolls the Zippo between his fingers. Jeep watches his father from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get back out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gimme another minute with him, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep nods, quietly leaves his father at the side of his d friend.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA'S FACE
dialogues.text: Catatonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Bob are tying Sandra to a chair. Not like it looks like she's capable of going anywhere, but you never know. Across the diner, Charlie eyes Michael cautiously. Michae never goes for more than a few moments without looking up her. It's not lecherous. More like a protective father making sure his child hasn't strayed too far. In a booth, Audrey watches, red-eyed, as Michael restrain her mother. Then she returns her attention to Percy's rad Tuning. Trying to find something, anything in the STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings her ear up close.      Wait.   Is that a VOICE She adjusts the antenna, trying to bring the signal into focus. CLEARER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEARER.   Yes.   It's a VOICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You guys, I think I got something here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone drops what they're doing and quickly gathers aro the radio. THROUGH THE HAZE OF STATIC, A GRAVELY, TIRED VOICE. BEYOND BELIEF. BUT STILL BROADCASTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... battling has been fierce. The numbers of casualties are unknown but all indications are that they must be unimaginably large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're just joining us, we're getting some of the first bits of good news, if you can call it that, since this apocalypse began just twenty-four ago. A human militia has formed on the outskirts of Las Vegas and has begun to engage the enemy. Also down in the Four Corners area, we've been receiving unconfirmed reports of another resistance force gathering in Red Rock National in the northern Mojave Desert area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Rock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be more than an hour up the highway from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean we can leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    We're not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talkin' about? This is our chance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't risk being on the move when the child comes. It's too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks over at Charlie, defeated. She shakes her head, anger building. She sweeps some plates off the counter an races for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And as we fight this new enemy, may God give us the strength to survive and show mercy for those of us who are already lost...

dialogues.speaker: A CIGARETTE
dialogues.text: being lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands at the sink, cigarette to her lips, water running, stealing a private moment. She takes a deep drag feels the smoke filling her lungs, defiant. Then she catches a look at herself in the mirror, runs he hand along the curvature of her belly. Tears well up in h eyes, fear and anger overtaking her. She stamps out the cigarette in a fit of frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet. DRIFTING past sleeping figures to find Charli wide-awake, sitting at a booth, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's your turn not to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks up to see Jeep sit down across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep sees the strain on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean besides the fact that I just found out that I'm the mother of the Messiah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep smiles, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy thing is...I didn't want this baby. I even went down to the clinic, you know that? (off Jeep's reaction:) I remember sitting there in the waiting room, absolutely sure I was doin' the right thing...And that's when the feeling started. Like I was falling into the deepest, darkest hole imaginable. I couldn't breathe, I couldn't speak. I kept thinking this must be what death is like. And when finally they called my name, I ran. (BEAT) For a while after that I tried pretending that it was just cold feet, that I could go back if I wanted to, that I could decide to end it like I'd planned. Then I'd start to have that feeling again and I knew I didn't have a choice. Somehow this had already been decided. And it made me hate this thing that's been growing inside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, as Jeep considers her, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't say things like that, Charlie. It isn't right. You'll get through this. I know you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him, the bitterness overtaking her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you have so much faith in me, Jeep? God knows I've never given you or anybody else a reason to. Or is it that you just can't find any other hard-luck case to follow around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep's face hardens.   He gets up.   Hurt.   Frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're not the only who's suffered, okay? Let me know when you stop feeling sorry for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Jeep walks away, leaving Charlie to stare after him, disturbed and surprised by his response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand and wind.    The INVISIBLE SUN is sinking. Kyle and Audrey are bundled together on the roof, keeping watch. Kyle is showing her how to hold the MP5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Then you just flip this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey flips the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it. All the way down. Two clicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points the gun out into the haze like she's been hold one all her life. Off Kyle's surprised look:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dated this guy last summer. A marine. Had a thing for guns. Parents hated him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Audrey switches the safety back on.   Han the gun over to Kyle. Audrey stares into the red nothingness surrounding them. expression growing distant. She seems to have aged years overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents hate everything I do. That's why we were moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They thought a more "wholesome" environment would help me "change my ways." So fucked up. Only reason they care at all is cuz they don't want to be embarrassed in front of their friends at the country club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle considers her thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only time my old man ever paid attention to me was when I was doing somethin' bad. So you know what I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got really good at being bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at this confession.    Can obviously relate. wipes a tear from her cheek. She leans in.   Kisses him.   Passionately.   Desperately His hands trace over her body. She claws at him. Her passion growing out of control. She's practically devouring him. Kyle can barely keep up. It's like something else beyond sensual need has taken ov She moves down his chest.     Further.   Kyle leans his h back. Further. Just then the SPOT LIGHTS that illuminate the roof sign c to life.   The young couple stops to look up at the brill red word "Paradise" illuminated above them. Down below, the gas pumps LIGHT UP.      The station's FLUORESCENTS flicker on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once the entire diner COMES BACK TO LIFE. The jukebox WHIRS ON, filling the room with Merle Haggard "I'm a Lonesome Fugitive". Bob's TV glows with bright rolling STATIC. The electric fan spins on above the grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep and Michael move to look through the slats at the window. Charlie is giving Sandra some water through a straw. Bob wanders in, squinting at the sudden presence of light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We back in business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck stop is lit up like a Christmas tree. If you didn't know better, you might mistake the place for busin as usual. Kyle and Audrey stand on the roof, taking in th dramatic change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADLIGHTS appear on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his gun) You better get downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle stares at Audrey's beautiful, determined face.    Th pulls out his silver 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing her the gun) Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headlights become a FAMILY MINIVAN careening wildly o the highway to stop at the pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They aim their weapons at the vehicle. A well dressed MAN in his mid-thirties jumps out of the c He looks around nervously, scared. Then, seeing that the coast is clear, he offers a calming wave to his WIFE and YOUNG BOY who wait anxiously for him inside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races around to the gas pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his gun) Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, are they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant SCREECH from behind. Kyle and Audrey spin to lo out over the back side of the diner. AN ARMY OF DARK SHAPES are swarming in fast. Kyle looks urgently back at the family.    The father lif pump. Flips the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap. They saw them coming and turned on the lights. It's a fucking trap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Audrey wave their arms frantically at the family

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Get back in your car!      It's a trap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But down below, the man can only hear the sound of RAGING WIND as he pumps the gas. Kyle fires his gun in the air.   BLAM!   BLAM!     BLAM! At the sound of gunfire, the man looks quickly up to the roof.   His family heard it too and they start to SCREAM HIM. The man can only see silhouettes in this light, but he's not waiting around to see if it's friend or foe. Audrey watches in horror as the dark shapes reach the din

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father dashes to the driver's side.    He throws open door. But he's too late. He looks over his shoulder just in tim to see a BLUR OF MOVEMENT RUSHING AT HIM. His BLOOD PAINTS the car windows. Kyle raises his MP5 to fire upon the dark shapes that surround the vehicle like swarming insects. The wife and boy scream hysterically as they are torn fro the vehicle by skeletal hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing his barrel down) Wait! You'll hit them too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Kyle makes a desperately courageous play. He leaps ont the roof's sloped overhang -- sliding fast -- he drops to ground in front of the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle charges the dark mob. Creatures peel away from the woman and boy to confront Kyle head-on. He lets loose with a rain of bullets, eviscerating everyt that comes at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group gathered at the window sees Kyle racing out tow the pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what the hell is that boy doin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get `im back in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob springs into action.   Pushes the booth away from the front door. The sound of a gun COCKING. Bob looks over to see Michael pointing a gun at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. You open that door and we could all be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Possessed move in from all sides, but Kyle is remarka agile, dropping one after another in a stunning display. He closes in on the family, blasting back the creatures huddled around them. He finds the YOUNG BOY curled up with his hands protectiv covering his face. Kyle swoops down and gathers the boy into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle moves on to the mother. But something odd is happeni The creatures have stopped coming at him. In fact, they're just standing there watching him.   Wait Kyle freezes.   CLOSE ON HIM as he senses something terri wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle looks over at the boy in his arms.   GHOSTLY WHITE E stare back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS) Fooled ya.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF TEETH AS KYLE'S THROAT IS TORN OUT.
dialogues.text: Kyle drops to his knees. Up on the roof, Audrey watches helplessly as Kyle falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob kicks over a table in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it all to hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.   Audrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window they see Audrey drop down from the roof an run towards Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young boy stands over Kyle, silently watching the lif drain from his body. The boy looks up to see Audrey approaching fast. Tears suddenly appear in his eyes. He opens his arms pleadingly her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry!     I didn't mean to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey raises the 45 and ...     CLICK.   CLICK.   CLICK. She keeps pulling the trigger.    Nothing. The boy's tears stop instantly. He looks at her with an eerie calm for someone so young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna die now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy moves toward Audrey, stepping over Kyle's body. Audrey backs away. She looks toward the entrance to the diner. Blocked by advancing creatures. They're everywhere.    She's trapped. She notices the open door to the MINIVAN.     And so she Audrey dives into the car as the throng of creatures rapi closes in. She hammers the auto door lock. CLUNK! She moves to the center of the car as gruesome faces pres against the windows. A nightmare come to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic. Charlie rushes to Michael's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have no heart?!     She's just a kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's immovable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let her die! (grabbing a gun from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear if you don't do something, I will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie COCKS the gun, moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks back at him, defiant.   No one breathes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his guns) Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob springs into action, clearing the door and flipping t dead bolt. The door is opened and Michael charges passed Charlie and out into hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With stunning calm, Michael marches straight for the pump IN THE MINIVAN, Audrey screams as the windows begin to CR She's running out of time. Michael grabs a gas pump, flips the lever and points it a the minivan. What's he up to? The creatures covering the car turn to look at Michael as they've just now noticed him. And that's when he starts spraying gas at them. But wait, there's more to this trick. Up comes Michael's Glock in h other hand and BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! The spray of gas EXPLODES into a SPRAY OF FIRE! The MINIVAN is engulfed in flames. Creatures tear away from the car like fiery comets throug the night. The windows EXPLODE, showering Audrey with tiny shards of glass. Michael drops the gas pump. He reaches through a fire rimmed broken car window and unlocks the door. Audrey looks up to see Michael's expressionless face CIRC BY A RING OF FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, fire is spreading quickly under the car... Michael pulls Audrey from the flaming vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And together they run toward the open diner door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's eyes go wide at the insanity they're witnessin Audrey is the first one in. Michael is almost there.   But the fire is faster, ENGULF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling Charlie away from the door) Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURSTING OUT OF THE FLAMES, Michael marches confidently i the diner. Jeep slams the door CLOSED just as the WALL OF FIRE REACHES THEM. Everyone hits the deck as the FIRE SHOOTS THROUGH THE SLA covering the windows like spindly fingers reaching for pr Michael's clothes are a smoky, smoldering mess.   Jeep an rush to pat him down. Audrey's coughing from the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get some water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie dashes behind the counter to the sink.    She fil a pitcher of water. She turns away from the sink with the filled pitcher... And SCREAMS! The YOUNG BOY with the lifeless white eyes stands before wielding an ENORMOUS BUTCHER'S KNIFE. The pitcher shatters LOUDLY on the floor. The boy swings the knife at her, slicing open the waitres outfit covering her pregnant belly. Charlie tumbles back to the ground behind the counter. Sh frantically pushes herself away from the approaching boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she doesn't have far to go before she'll run out of r to maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, don't be scared. I just wanna play with your baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.    She's backed against the end of the counter The boy raises the knife to strike. Charlie grabs a baking pan off a shelf. Swings it out in front of her body like a shield, as the KNIFE IS DRIVEN D CLANG! The knife hits the pan hard and stops. But the boy hands don't. They slip off the handle and run right down blade. The knife CLATTERS to the ground. The boy instinctively raises his hands to strike again, b there's no knife. Charlie watches in horror as the boy calmly realizes that THUMBS ARE MISSING. Blood sprays from the stumps. Charlie pulls her legs in close then rockets them out at boy's chest. He's catapulted away from her. Michael leaps over the counter, landing in front of Charl guns ready for action. But the boy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the electricity goes out once again, PLUNGING DINER BACK INTO DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHLIGHT BEAMS fan out across the diner. LIGHTING under chairs.    Under tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is he?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCAMPERING SOUND... MOVING FAST.    Everybody spins to the location of the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as they move in one direction, the SCAMPERING is heard in another. Jeep's LIGHT CATCHES SOMETHING ON THE GROUND.      A TRAI BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bleeding!

dialogues.speaker: A WALL...
dialogues.text: Jeep raises his LIGHT UP THE WALL WHERE THE TRAIL OF BLOO REACHES THE CEILING AND...STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: LANDS ON BOB'S BACK.
dialogues.text: Bob flails around trying to pull the boy's small, but dea strong arms away from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep can't get a clear shot.       Bob's gasping for air. Michael grabs the boy and fiercely rips him off of Bob's back. He swings the boy around like a living shot put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep and Bob whip up their guns as Michael throws the wic creature into the air. Sandra's vacant face flickers in the light as the SOUND O GUNFIRE AND INHUMAN SCREAMING fill the diner. And then in moments...      All is QUIET. BEHIND THE COUNTER, Audrey helps Charlie to her feet. WINCES. Doubles over, clutching her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael lowers his flashlight.      CLEAR FLUID runs down Charlie's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inky darkness.   A flickering light emanates from within diner. TITLE:   "December 25th - 3:33am" The sound of CHARLIE'S SCREAM, carries us to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, drenched in sweat is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between legs. Pots of steaming water surround them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do? Just `cause I'm a girl doesn't mean I automatically know how to do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do as I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but, how do you know how to do this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Jeep keep watch. The SPECTRAL LIGHTS in the distance seem to be growing la -- closer. Charlie's SCREAMING rises up from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a way to bring a child into the world. (looks over at Jeep) She ever tell you his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's never said. I just assumed it was Joe Danvers. You know how she's always had a thing for bad boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob hears the spite in Jeep's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep, sooner or later she'll realize you're the best thing that's ever happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said I should move on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't a father be wrong sometimes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep considers Bob with a smile, then comes the sound... A DEEP, LONG, BODY RUMBLING TONE rising up off the plain, if emanating from the largest HORN ever constructed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPECTRAL LIGHTS dot the landscape now with untold numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael reacts to the sound. An urgency comes over him. Audrey arrives with more steaming water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming. We have to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's coming? Whaddya mean hurry? This isn't something you can exactly hurry, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, I need you to push. I need you to push as hard as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, who's coming?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie pushes, tears streaming down her face, delirious pain. It's a gruesome, bloody affair. It's getting close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep and Bob watch helplessly as the ARMY OF CREATURES ha closed within a hundred yards of the diner. Their ranks stretch back seemingly without end into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna make it outta here, are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at his son.   The agony stretched across his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Jeep. This shouldn't be happening to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder. Bo pulls his son close and hugs him with all his might, tear filling his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the dirt and darkness, Charlie lets out a final agonizing SCREAM... ...and then comes a BABY'S CRIES.   Audrey, eyes wide, ho up the CHILD. Stunned. Elated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god...we did it!    Charlie, you did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey places the child in Charlie's arms. She stares at baby, holding it at a distance, unsure of whether to embr it or be terrified by it. A commitment she's not yet read to make, even at this late hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONFUSED) It's okay. The baby's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks to Audrey, tears streaming down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey looks to Michael, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him... Give her a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey nods, takes the baby back from Charlie, tries to soothe him by pacing around the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...It's okay...Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another DRONE OF THE HORN RATTLES THE WALLS.      Menacin Closer. Audrey   reacts, crosses to the counter, turns on the rad trying   to drown out the sound of the approaching menace of the   STATIC, the haunting sounds of BING CROSBY singi SILENT   NIGHT fills the room. The quiet before the storm Michael helps Charlie quickly clean herself up.     She s at him, a burning spite in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are we safe now?   Is it over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Killing the child would have ended the war before it had begun. Now, at least, he will have a chance to grow up, a chance to lead the world out of darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those words provide her little comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens until then...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need to teach him how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie shakes her head, this is all too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I can do that? What makes you think I want to do that? If he's so important, why don't you take him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of us has a burden. This one is yours and yours alone. Maybe someday you'll understand what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Charlie's look, we move across the diner where Audrey approaches her mother, kneels down in front of her. Despi how much her mother pisses her off, it breaks her heart t see her in such a demoralized state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama? Can you hear me? (holds up the baby) We did it...The baby's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUDREY (cont'd) (BEAT) Mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Sandra hears her daughter, it doesn't show in her face Tears well up in Audrey's eyes as she moves away from her mother. But we HOLD here and... DRIFT DOWN BEHIND THE CHAIR TO REVEAL Sandra's hands are loosening the bonds. BLOOD TRICKLES from where the rope's cut through her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRIFTING THROUGH the dark shapes as the BABY'S CRIES reverberate up and down the ranks. They begin to look abo frantically, agitated by the sound. Some even begin to ba away from the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off in the distance, the diner is but a dim flickering li above the plain. It could almost be mistaken for a stable a desert town a long time ago. THREE STARS burn bright and low in the black sky. All around us the DARK CREATURES are cowering from sound the CRYING INFANT whose wails seem to grow even LOUDER th further away from the diner we get.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE THE TRUCK STOP
dialogues.text: In the darkness below we see the lights of the legions of creatures dot the landscape and at the center of it all, truck stop. The sound of WINGS BEATING AGAINST THE WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep and Bob enter the diner to see Michael helping Charl to her feet, while Audrey continues to pace, the bundle o bloody blankets cradled in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happening.    They're moving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Possessed can't come near the child, so He sent someone that can. Someone like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel. My lieutenant.      He's come to do what I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JEEP as the realization hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your orders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one who was supposed to kill the baby? That was the order you didn't obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods grimly.    Charlie looks urgently at Michael

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby CRIES LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, what the hell's he talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was never meant to be a Second Coming. But we've just changed that. The child lives. The future is unwritten. There's still hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, shaken by this revelation, reaches out to Audrey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey moves to hand over the baby to Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: SNATCHES THE BABY FROM AUDREY'S ARMS
dialogues.text: Sandra backs away from them, moving toward the front door Hers is the face of madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me!    Don't come any closer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what he said. They just want the baby. Maybe if we just give it to them, then they'll let us go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael cocks his gun.   Points it at Sandra.

dialogues.speaker: THE DINER. IT'S RIGHT OUTSIDE THE DOOR.
dialogues.text: Charlie squares off with Sandra, panic in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?! You never wanted him in the first place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stares at her in horror, the truth of those words rattling her to the very core.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra is almost to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just one baby.   Just one.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: A brilliant SPECTRAL LIGHT pours into the diner. Sandra is blinded.   She raises a hand to block the light And that's when Michael fires.    BLAM! Sandra staggers back, blood dripping from the hole in her forehead, and...

dialogues.speaker: ...THE BABY GOES FLYING OUT OF HER HANDS
dialogues.text: Charlie screams and the WORLD MOVES INTO SLOW MOTION... everything suddenly goes very QUIET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael fires again.   Blowing Sandra's body back through doorway. Jeep watches the baby sail SLOWLY through the air. The time for Jeep to act is now! Jeep DIVES for the baby...catching the bundle of rags mer inches from the ground! And then he looks up to see... The dark SILHOUETTE OF A MAN approaching from out of the spectral light. A MAN WITH WINGS. Jeep's eyes grow wide as the FIERCE ANGEL steps into the diner. But this looks like no angel we've seen before. This is a creature built for war. Rough hewn, battle scarred. His body armor making him appear disturbingly insect like. His wings are not feathery or gentle. Rather they are hard, mechanical, an organic machine. The angel's wings retract with clockwork-like precision. And now that we see the his face clearly, we notice his striking resemblance to Michael. We might even mistake th for brothers. His name is GABRIEL. Gabriel raises a massive, ferocious, strangely mechanical looking MACE in his powerful hands. And the world returns to NORMAL SPEED as Gabriel brings t mace arcing down at Jeep. Jeep rolls! CLANG! The weapon just misses him, hitting th floor in a spray of sparks, literally CRACKING THE GROUND Gabriel brings the mace up again.   Jeep won't be so luck twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonuvabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob charges at the creature, sub-machine gun blazing. Gabriel reacts by instantly UNFOLDING HIS WINGS and launc himself into the air. The bullets clawing up the wall beh him. But Bob's heroic move has given Jeep time to get up and r with the baby for the back of the diner. He thrusts the child into Charlie's hands. And without even thinking, sh pulls the child protectively to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel drops down in front of Bob, whipping his wings ar like a deadly, RAZOR SHARP FAN! Bob stops firing, a look of surprise stretches over his f His gun falling from his hands. Blood begins to pour out of the slice across his belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sweep of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across diner where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove. Michael GRABS JEEP'S HAND before the boy can rush back in the fray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jeep! You must protect the child now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?!   What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My path ends here. You are the true protector. You always have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep shakes his head, panic setting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know what to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the Prophets.   Learn to read the instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael lets go of Jeep's hand and turns away to face Gabriel, leaving Jeep to contemplate those final words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prophets? What Prophets?   What instructions?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when Jeep opens his hand to find the KEYS to Michael's Police Cruiser. Jeep looks up from the keys to see Charlie, Audrey and th baby. The responsibility crashing in on him. Then he clos his hand around the keys, determination building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks past Jeep to see Michael returning to the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!     We can't leave him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no choice!    We have to get to Red Rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls Charlie past the counter toward the back office. Jeep stops when he sees his father's broken body lying on ground by the stove in a pool of his own blood. Bob's half open eyes focus on his son. In his outstretche hand is that goddamn ZIPPO LIGHTER... and next to that, a BROKEN GAS PIPE leading to the stove. Jeep is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep tries to help him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me, Jeep.     My place is here, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dad...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob smiles weakly at his son and says simply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so Jeep, fighting back tears, does what his father sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey and Jeep push the desk away from the door. Charlie opens it.    Sand swirls in around her. And Jeep leads the trio out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Gabriel square off in the diner, not like enemies, but like brothers on opposite sides of a terribl family conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew he'd send you, Gabriel. You were always so eager to please Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike you...the rebellious son. (noticing Michael's scars) Pity about your wings. They would have helped you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To not feel their burden...is a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can defy Him and not pay the price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child lives. What happens to me doesn't matter now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours is a fool's sacrifice. You can help them sneak out the back door, but they won't escape. (BEAT) And neither will you, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael slowly approaches Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SOFT) I'm not running anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel hesitates, doubt clouding his face.    This was n what he was expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SENSING) Join with me. You don't need do this. There's another way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Gabriel's expression hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no other way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls back from Michael, raising the mace -- SCHING! - LONG DEADLY SHARP SPIKES BURSTS FROM ALL ITS SIDES...as i wasn't bad-ass enough. And the fight begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mace against machine gun and strangely enough, it se under Gabriel's deft control, the mace is the vastly supe weapon. With the aid of his wings, Gabriel moves with staggering speed, defying gravity to avoid the rain of bullets. The place is getting absolutely shot to hell. Michael leaps from table top to table top as Gabriel brin the mace brutally down -- splintering everything it touch Michael leaps onto the last unbroken table top -- spins t fire. Gabriel pushes into the air, jabbing a spike straig into the barrel of Michael's MP5. The gun explodes in Michael's hands, sending him rocketing backwards where he lands on the counter. Gabriel swoops in fast. Michael kicks him in the chest, sending him fluttering back. Michael thrusts himself to his feet.   Gabriel recovers, again. Michael grabs a hold of Bob's ceiling mounted TV for supp and lifts his body just above the deadly spike. Michael kicks Gabriel in the head, momentarily stunning h Michael dives at Gabriel, landing an awesome flurry of punches. Gabriel is rattled back by the assault.   He clumsily lif his mace and thrusts with it. Michael narrowly evades the razor point, which drives int wall. Michael smashes down on Gabriel's wrist, CRACKING the bon A swift kick to the chest and Gabriel is thrust crashing back, losing his grip on the weapon. Michael takes a running leap onto Gabriel's back. Gabriel launches wildly into the air, trying to throw Mic off. They hit the ceiling, but Michael hangs on. Choking the life out of Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey and Jeep help Charlie quickly move around the side the diner where the cruiser is parked. They are buffeted winds and sand. Jeep puts Charlie and the baby into the front passenger s while Audrey hustles in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep rounds to the driver's side.     Hops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep frantically tries to get the right key into the ignition. It's in. Jeep turns the key but the ENGINE STRUGGLES TO FIRE UP. Panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep gives it some gas, but the ENGINE'S NOT CATCHING. A DARK SHAPE POUNCES ONTO THE HOOD OF THE CAR. The light catches it, revealing the disfigured face and beard of a SHOPPING MALL SANTA CLAUS, his oversized belly gruesomely distended. Charlie screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep pumps the gas and the ENGINE BURSTS TO LIFE! The creature's about to punch a fist through the glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing the car in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep floors it, causing the cruiser to rocket backwards toward the highway.

dialogues.speaker: BUT THE CREATURE HANGS ON
dialogues.text: Jeep pulls the wheel hard and the cruiser whips around a 180 onto the road. THE CREATURE SHOOTS OFF THE CAR AND HITS THE ASPHALT. Jeep throws it in drive just as the POSSESSED SANTA rises from the pavement. Pedal to the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature doesn't have a chance as the cruiser PLOWS i him. BONES CRUNCH as a flash of red and white is sent sailing the car and tumbling down onto the road behind them in a cloud of dust. Jeep clenches the wheel, pedal to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we need to figure out our weapon situation.   Hopefully Michael didn't take everything out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep places his Glock on the dash. He sees that he's got police issue shotgun in the front seat rack. Charlie searches under her seat.   Pulls out a...GRENADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Now just put it down... Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie places it onto the seat. Audrey fishes around in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up each item) Okay, all I got is a flare gun thing. Looks like we got a box of flares to go with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. Handgun. Shotgun. A a flare gun... And a grenade. Alright. (hands Charlie the Glock) Load this. (BEAT) Audrey, can you figure out how to load that flare gun without killing us all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try real hard, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey anxiously sets about loading the flare gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel flies into a wall in an attempt to crush Michael. fails that but succeeds in leaving a massive dent. Gabriel runs/flies for the opposite wall. This one doesn' hold and the two enemies crash through it into the bathro Unbelievably Michael is still holding on. Gabriel is up. He thrusts himself back into the bathroom mirror. It shatters painfully behind Michael. Gabriel rages out of the bathroom and into the diner. Michael continues to ride him like a wild bull. Gabriel slams Michael into a wall once more.   It's a bru struggle. Gabriel spots his mace sticking out of the wall within ar reach. He grabs it, holding it futilely in front of him. From th angle he'd never be able to hit Michael with it. Gabriel' strength is giving way. Michael is winning. Gabriel lets out a tremendous ROAR and plunges one of the mace's long spikes into his own stomach. Michael's eyes g wide with surprise, his grip loosens. Gabriel has run the both through. Gabriel rips the mace from his body and stumbles forward. Blood pours from a huge hole in Michael's chest.   Right through his heart. Gabriel looks down at the hole in his own belly. Not near as bad as Michael's. Apparently there's not a lot of bloo left in this guy. Michael falls to his knees.   Weakening. Gabriel looms over Michael.   Michael looks up at him, bl leaking from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always wanted to live like one of them...Now you'll know how it feels to die like one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head. Michael closes his eyes.   Submitting. The mace comes swinging down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser hits the FLY STORM. Black. Nothing is visible beyond the windows. BUZZING surrounds them. DEAFENING. Jeep turns on the windshield wipers.     Hits the brights PING!   PING!   PING!   Driving blind! ON THE SPEEDOMETER as their speed slows to a crawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fuckin' see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's desperately trying to soothe her SCREAMING baby ON THE AIR VENTS as FLIES start crawling in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel is looking down upon Michael's broken body. Something is happening to his skin. The DARK WRITING THAT COVERS HIS BODY is beginning UN-WRITE itself and DISAPPEA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is struggling to close the air vents to stop the inflow of BUZZING insects. It's not working! She looks to Jeep in desperation, but something more frightening catches her attention. The INTRICATE WRITING is beginning to appear on Jeep's ar snaking its way up from his wrists like VINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep, your arm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep sees it, eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as Jeep remembers Michael's parting words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instructions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel watches as the last of the writing FADES from Michael's body when he hears a faint CLICKING sound from somewhere in the diner. Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner, tow the source of the CLICKING. He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a mass pool of blood. It takes the creature a moment to realize that the CLICKI sound is coming from Bob's SILVER ZIPPO. Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter. CLICK... CLICK... CLICK... Bob looks at Gabriel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...   We're closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with one last brush of his thumb, Bob's trusty ZIPPO IGNITES. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the TINY FLAME DANCES in front the stove's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MASSIVE EXPLOSION rocks the slow moving vehicle. In the rearview mirror, Jeep sees the CLOUD OF FIRE MUSHROOMING UP in the sky behind them. It's eerily magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swarm, it's fading!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep looks back to the road as, sure enough, the FLY SWAR suddenly dissipates all around them, revealing a CLEAR VI of the highway ahead. Jeep knows at what price this good fortune has come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser PUNCHES through the burning "Paradise" sign, smashing it into fiery pieces! The cruiser charges on down the endless highway, burning of sign swirling in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the back seat, Audrey watches the fire recede into t distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.   Is it really over...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up front Jeep stares out at the dark road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...It's just starting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning wreckage everywhere. DRIFTING THROUGH IT until we settle on the SPIKE-SCEPTER stuck firmly in the ground. Flames ring the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser blazes down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie cradles the baby, apprehensive. The baby looks up her, smiles. She can't help but smile back at him. Jeep eyes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not hold him too long. Might get attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks over, feels his lingering anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry for what I said to you earlier, `bout you following me around. I didn't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' to be sorry about. It's true. I did follow you around. At least now I know there was a good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's reacts, a bit stung. Jeep tries to hide his pleasure that the tables have turn at least a little. Charlie is about to respond when Audre leans in from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points ahead to a beaten up road sign that says: "Now Entering Red Rock National Park, Next Rest Stop 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, all we gotta do is --

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: The roof buckles above them.   The windows BLOW OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep, Charlie and Audrey slip frantically down in their s as the roof presses down at them. The windows BURST. Jeep grabs the Glock and fires wildly up at the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel takes a direct hit in the thigh, causing him to s off the roof and onto the trunk where he grabs a hold of rear window frame for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With tremendous strength, Gabriel pulls his upper body through the broken back window toward Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep swings the gun around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Gabriel takes one in the shoulder, but it doesn't s him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey, the flare gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. Jeep can't get off another shot without risk of hitting Audrey. Gabriel is almost entirely in the car now. Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he knocks hand aside just as she pulls the trigger and the flare go off INSIDE THE CAR! Jeep ducks. The CAR SWERVES MADLY. The flare RICOCHETS through the cabin, lighting it up like the Fourth of July Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the flare bounces off windshield - PING! - and nails him right in the face, SET HIS HAIR ABLAZE. And that gives Jeep the chance to swing around and FIRE. BOOM! Gabriel is blown back partially through the rear window. He holds onto the car with an iron grip. Starts t pull himself back in. Nothing slows this guy down. Jeep pulls the trigger again and...CLICK.    No bullets! Audrey frantically reloads the flare gun. Brings it up to fire, but he's too fast! WHACK! Gabriel knocks her into t side of the car with a sweep of his hand. She's out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's clawing his way unobstructed toward Charlie agai Jeep knows there's only one thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat. Jeep PUNCHES IT.   The speedometer leaps ahead. 70...80...90... Gabriel's now completely in the car.   They're helpless. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, grasping for Char his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, whe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off her, you fucking asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie in time. He flails wildly about but this young girl rides him like one helluva a cowboy. 100...110...120...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Jeep! Do it now!

dialogues.speaker: FORWARD THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD LIKE A BULLET.
dialogues.text: The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and ROLL INTO A BALL OF FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cruiser spins out of control, swerving off the road a careening into a large rock formation. This ride is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep's side of the car is crushed.   Blood is running dow forehead. Charlie crawls up from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to focus on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks open her door and begins pulling him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing could have survived that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ANGUISHED) Audrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saved us, Jeep. Audrey saved us. Now c'mon, we gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, the baby bundled in her hands, leads Jeep away f the demolished Cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep and Charlie, battered and bruised, struggle to make long climb up the ridge. Charlie looks up. STARS completely fill the pre-dawn sky.   Breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can this happen in a world so beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep follows her gaze to the sky. Endless stars.    Confounding. Jeep shifts his eyes to the TOP OF THE RIDGE just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, we're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are only a few steps from the EDGE OF THE RIDGE when

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL ROCKETS UP IN FRONT OF THEM
dialogues.text: Charlie screams! Jeep pushes her and the baby out of the just as Gabriel comes down hard in front of them, kicking a cloud of dust. Gabriel's mechanical wings haltingly retract. The crash h done some serious damage. Much of his skin has burned awa Chunks of his armor and flesh are missing as well, includ a large part of his head, revealing that under his human visage is a NIGHTMARISH CREATURE. Gabriel charges at Jeep fast. Jeep whips up his Glock, BL Gabriel takes the bullet, then slaps the gun out of Jeep' hand. Jeep throws a wild punch, connects with Gabriel's chin, rocking him back. More annoyed than surprised, Gabriel knocks Jeep savagely to the ground. Jeep struggles quickly to his feet, comes right back at Gabriel swinging. But Gabriel simply knocks him to the di again. Jeep slowly gets up once more, bleeding, hurt.   Raises h fists. This kid will simply not give up. Jeep moves in again, swinging hard, but Gabriel blocks it shoots out a hand and grabs Jeep by throat, lifting him c off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So brave. So pointless. You should have worried more about saving yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep's feet dangle. His eyes bulge out. He claws at Gabriel's iron-fast grip, but there's no hope. Charlie watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!   Please! Don't kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gabriel is doing just that. Jeep is rapidly losing consciousness. The battle is lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep's eyes flutter.   He's almost gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!   I'LL GIVE YOU THE BABY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets Gabriel's attention. Charlie climbs to her feet, holding the bloody bundle out him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want this responsibility!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears run down her face.   She's dead fucking serious. Gabriel lets go of Jeep.   He falls to the ground, gaspin desperately for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel takes the bundle from Charlie, turning away from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And as the child's cries are extinguished, an eternal darkness at last descended upon the world."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peels the cloth back, revealing... THE GRENADE. He spins around to face Charlie. She's holding the pin.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL IS BLOWN TO BLOODY BITS.
dialogues.text: The creature is gone at last. The sound of a BABY COOING. Charlie picks the child up out of the brush. She helps Jeep to his feet and together they slowly make their way to the top of the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep and Charlie stand overlooking the desert valley belo ON THEIR FACES, reacting to what they see. Charlie takes Jeep's hand in hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, we sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see it too:

dialogues.speaker: THE MOJAVE DESERT
dialogues.text: Vast.   Barren.   No signs of life. No resistance force.    No nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ON JEEP AND CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Taking it in.     Breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they're just over the next ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at Charlie.    Worry in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we're on our own now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid.    We'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At those words, Charlie looks deep into Jeep's eyes. confidence in them she's never seen before. And she leans in and kisses him.      Tender. When they part, Jeep stares back at her with surprise. the surprise melts into a smile. And they descend the ridge...out of sight, leaving us wit view once again of --

dialogues.speaker: THE MOJAVE DESERT
dialogues.text: A BLOOD RED SUN rises behind the distant mountains. The unbearable cold will soon become an unbearable heat. And we're back where we started. A YOUNG WOMAN'S VOICE.    Solemn.   Weary.   Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday when my son is older, I will tell him about the time of his birth when all the world was covered in a great darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep is at the wheel. He looks aged, scarred from the experience. His exposed arms are completely covered with INTRICATE WRITING...The Instructions. The boy he once was gone at last and the warrior protector has replaced him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And how just at the moment when everything seemed lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sits across from him, the baby cradled in her arm It's strange, but you might actually mistake them for a h family. Of course you'll have to ignore the ARSENAL OF WEAPONRY in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a mighty warrior fell in order to save me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep glances over at Charlie and the baby.   He smiles at image of maternal bliss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a boy faced his fear and rose up to save us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines through the car windows, filling our eyes its fiery light.
